content: Hi all, I'm a Master's student working on real-time systems security. My thesis involves static analysis in the Rust compiler. I'd love to learn more about how MIR optimization works. I'm working on composing a question for #t-compiler/help!
You're probably aware of https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org? It talks a little about MIR, including a short page about optimizations.
Yes! I've read most of sections 2 and 3. For my project I've built and run a fork of the compiler with some AST, HIR, and MIR-level modifications.
